I make things with code. I use Javascript a lot. See for yourself...



Jupit - Travel Planner

Virtual travel assistant easily connecting travellers to Airbnb lodging, Eventbrite local events, and Google Flight fares in one easy search. Made with Meteor.js.

Miami Budget

D3 visualization of Miami Dade County's 2016 budget proposal from Miami's open data portal. Made in collaboration with Code for Miami.

Best Damn Me Tracker

Mobile web app that lets you track anything and learn from the patterns of your behavior. Uses Angular 2, ngrx, RxJS, and Firebase.

I've worked for some interesting people. Check them out...



Biznobo

As this startup's first hire, we used RxJS, microservices, Firebase, and a React-like frontend to help business owners track user's across platforms and automate personalize marketing, leveraing 3rd party APIs like Mailchimp and KeenIO.

PeopleTicker

This job rate search engine crunched compensation rates based on the job description, the candidate's experience, and the location of the company. I developed a real-time data pipeline of job postings using Python and Apache Solr, and the job rate engine using Java.

Walt Disney Parks

As a junior dev on the team that launched Disney's brand-new web experience, my team integrated all other services and I participated in making developer tools such as service heartbeat monitors, easy environment config switching, and data manipulating Python scripts.
